title: Application Manager- Operations
description:
Adapteo Group is growing and at Group IT we are on a journey together with our business to digitalize our core operational processes. In this journey we are now seeking an Application Manager to support the roll-out, management, maintenance and optimization of Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC) and Autodesk Revit.
 



  





 While the roll-out to all Adapteo operating markets is led by a Project Manager, you will play a crucial role by contributing with hands-on knowledge and expertise to ensure successful implementation, adoption and continuous improvement once in place. Additionally, you will oversee key operations tools for Adapteo such as Monday.com, Lumion, and Oculo, while establishing application management forums to drive best practices and continuous improvement. If you have a strong technical background and enjoy working collaboratively to enhance digital solutions, we want to hear from you!
 



 ,
 



**As An Operations Application Manager, You Will** 



* Support the roll-out of Autodesk Construction Cloud and Revit, providing handson expertise and advice to ensure smooth adoption.
* Act as an application advisor, assisting the Project Manager with implementation strategies and best practices.
* Establish and lead application management forums for ACC and Revit, facilitating collaboration and continuous improvement.
* Oversee and optimize the use of Monday.com, Lumion, and Oculo.
* Provide and coordinate second line support, training, and documentation for key applications.
* Collaborate with internal teams such as our ERP Team and business process owners to improve processes, systems and data quality. And if you know anything about Business Central it’s a plus!
* Coordinate, align and communicate around software updates, troubleshoot issues, and ensure data integrity.
* Manage licenses and our key vendors that support our key operational tools.



  





**The Ideal Candidate Has** 



* A proven experience with ACC and Revit or similar collaboration and 3D design tools.
* Familiarity with Monday.com, Lumion, and Oculo or similar tools is a plus.
* Experience in supporting business system roll-outs and working closely with project teams to ensure adoption of the suite according to group and local processes.
* Experience in designing, implementing and drive application management:
* Outline and agree on business priorities within applications.
* Establish and drive super user communities.
* Establish support organizations/processes (where super users are 1st line of support).
* Create and maintain application and end-user documentation.
* Manage vendors and licenses.
* Experience from acting as second line support.
* Experience from working/collaborating with ERP teams on operations processes.
* But most importantly the right attitude and willingness to learn quickly, to connect the dots even if they are far apart!



  





 If this sounds like a role for you, don’t hesitate to reach out! We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.

title: Unit Manager - Cyber Defence Center
description:
**Job Description**
 H&M Group is transforming the way it addresses the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have a Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments.
   

  

 Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a Cyber Defence Center (CDC) that is a key security function at H&M Group, which aims to detect and respond to threats to our data or technology systems, 24 x 7. The CDC has 3 teams located both in Stockholm and India, and consists of Cyber Defence Analysts, Attack Surface Reduction Analyst and Cyber Defence Engineers. The CDC also leverages the best-in-class security technology and security providers.
   

  

 This role reports to the Chief Technology Risk Information Officer (CISO).
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Lead and manage the Cyber Defence Center, ensuring effective coordination and collaboration among cyber defence teams.
* Develop and implement comprehensive cyber security strategies to protect the organization's digital assets.
* Provide leadership and technical guidance to managers of cyber defence teams, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.
* Enable strong organizational health by making sure that your employees prioritize both deliveries as well as own competence development.
* Oversee the identification, assessment, and mitigation of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
* Ensure compliance with relevant cyber security regulations and standards.
* Own and manage the cyber incident response and recovery processes, including coordination with stakeholders.
* Monitor and analyze cyber security trends and emerging threats to proactively address potential risks.
* Collaborate with other departments to integrate cyber security measures into business processes and initiatives.
* Prepare and present regular reports on the status of cyber security initiatives to senior management.
* Manage the units’ budget and monitor its financial effectiveness.
* Formal staff responsibility, including salary review, performance dialogues and support in individual development plans and competence needs.
* Contribute operationally, where necessary.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in cyber security, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Proven track record of managing and leading cyber defense teams.
* In-depth knowledge of cyber security frameworks, standards, and best practices.
* Strong understanding and a hands-on approach to threat intelligence, risk management, and incident response.
* Strong communication experience with demonstrated ability to influence people, even at senior levels, and ability to communicate in a timely and clear way
* Ability to coach others in a way that enables them to grow professionally and to increase their performance
* Experience setting and handling resource allocation budget.
* Experience with handling difficult situations both in uncertain circumstances as well as in employee related matters.
* Good at balancing striving for speed, reducing complexity, and focusing on the outcome
* Experience in managing complex cyber security projects and initiatives in a global scale
* Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to develop and grow your colleagues in complex environments.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple priorities.
* Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or equivalent.


**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is
 **based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Freelance English Writer - AI Tutor
description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.
   

  

**What We Do**
 The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 If you're a professional who works with text, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your writing, editing, and creative skills to an AI training project.
   

  

 As an AI Tutor - Writer, your work will help train an AI model, shaping how it understands and generates human-like text. This isn't just traditional copywriting—you'll be crafting responses that teach AI accuracy, nuance, and clarity.
   

  

 This is a freelance role for a short-term project, and your typical tasks may include:
   

  

* Crafting original, clear, and fact-checked responses based on project guidelines.
* Following style and quality standards to ensure consistency.
* Collaborating with QA Specialists to refine and improve outputs.


**How To Get Started**
 Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in communications, linguistics, literature, journalism or philology
* You have some professional or educational experience in creative writing, copywriting and editing in English
* Your level of English is proficient (C2)
* You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between projects and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
* Our freelance roles are fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


**Benefits**
**Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?**
* Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
* Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
* Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

title: (Senior) IT Consultant - Enterprise Solutions | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Nordic offices (Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen), we are looking for (Senior) IT Consultants for our Enterprise Solutions chapter! About The Job At BCG Platinion, we provide sound advice on all relevant IT issues. In particular, the migration to the SAP S/4HANA solution against the background of the planned mainstream maintenance presents our customers with special challenges. The typical questions our customers have range from justification and business benefits of the SAP S/4 HANA Transition to optimized roadmaps taking into account the implications on overall architecture and also alternative solutions and platforms. To serve our customers even better, we would like to strengthen our Enterprise Solutions team. You work together with colleagues from Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international customer projects. Together with our customers, you actively develop superior, business value driven ERP and application architecture strategies, concepts and roadmaps and apply your sound technical and process-related understanding. Last but not least, you enjoy your work and embody the 'BCG Platinion Spirit' with your hands-on manner.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**This Is How You Make a Difference**
* An above-average degree in computer science, business informatics, business administration or a related field
* At least 3 years of relevant experience in the context of strategic ERP/CRM/SCM projects
* Technical knowledge along typical end-to-end processes relevant in the enterprise solutions context (Purchase-2-Pay, Order-2-Cash, Lead-2-Quote, Record-2-Report, Hire-2-Retire etc.)
* General knowledge of wider portfolio of industry specific solutions, solution add-on’s and analytical tools Exceptional analytical and conceptual skills
* Fluent in one Nordic Language and English (written and spoken)
* Strong client and result orientation
* Team spirit, communication and presentation skills as well as intellectual agility
* Ability to align individuals and organizations to a common goal


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape The World Of Tomorrow**
* Supporting the client in ERP/CRM/SCM projects along the entire supply chain: from requirements analysis to solution design/technical concept, implementation, testing, training and rollout
* Design / definition of specific ERP/CRM/SCM solutions along the value chain of our clients and the required functional modules Introduction of 'best practices' in the evaluation, specification and implementation of user requirements, in particular with a view to reducing one-off and maintenance costs
* Technical management of implementation and migration projects or in specific domains Requirements management within the scope of enterprise solutions projects, incl. the management of specialist concept workshops with business process managers
* Control and prototyping of customizing of ERP/CRM/SCM solutions Support in the sale of large Enterprise Solutions projects by providing technical and methodological expertise
* Further development of the content of the enterprise solutions topics at BCG Platinion, e.g., through participation in conferences, in the creation of a training catalog or with technical articles


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

**Become a Part Of Our Team**
 Apply over our online portal now, with your CV, a relevant project list, and all pertinent references.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to national origin, color, age, sex, gender identity / expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or any other protected characteristic.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
At POC, we are a safety and performance pioneer on a global mission: protect lives and reduce the consequences of accidents for athletes and anyone inspired to be one. Born and based in Stockholm, Sweden, we challenge the status quo with research, science, and cutting-edge technology to create safer, better-performing products.
 



  





 Now, we are looking for a Digital Marketing Manager to develop and execute digital marketing strategies that drive online traffic, increase brand awareness, and generate leads and sales across the EU, NA, and APAC regions. If you’re ready to shape digital marketing strategy, work hands-on with campaigns, and turn ideas into action in a collaborative, fast-moving environment, this is your chance to make a real impact.
 



  
 



**The job:** 





 We are looking for a strategic Digital Marketing Managerto lead and optimize our digital marketing efforts, ensuring they drive business growth and value. This role is about maximizing the impact of digital marketing investments, improving campaign efficiency, and strengthening brand presence while ensuring seamless integrations, performance, and cost-effective operations to support business goals.
 




  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Strategy Development: Develop and implement comprehensive digital marketing strategies that align with business goals and drive online traffic, brand awareness, and sales across the EU, NA, and APAC regions.
* Campaign Management: Plan, execute, and optimize digital marketing campaigns across various channels, including search engines (SEO/SEM), social media, email marketing, and display advertising. Ensure campaigns are targeted, effective, and within budget.
* Performance Analysis: Analyze campaign performance metrics using web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) to measure the effectiveness of digital marketing efforts. Provide insights and recommendations for improvement based on data analysis.
* Agency and Partner Management: Manage relationships with digital agencies and advertising partners to ensure the delivery of high-quality services and successful campaign execution. Negotiate contracts and monitor performance.
* Reporting and Communication: Prepare and present regular reports on digital marketing performance to senior management. Communicate key insights, successes, and areas for improvement in a clear and concise manner.



  





**To be successful in this role, you are likely to have:** 



* A bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Digital Media, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* At least 5 years of experience in digital marketing, e-commerce, or a related role.
* Strong proficiency in digital marketing strategies, tools, and platforms, with expertise in SEO, SEM, social media marketing, email marketing, and display advertising.
* Strong analytical skills and experience with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.



  





**Why you should join POC:** 




 You will be able to shape and evolve the department, working hands-on with digital marketing while being deeply embedded in the business. The impact of your work will be tangible, moving fast from idea to execution to results. We are a collaborative, passionate team, where digital marketing needs to be closely connected to the entire business. You will work alongside skilled colleagues who are just as eager to share knowledge as they are to push boundaries.
 



  





 While we take our work seriously, we believe in balance. Whether it's lunch rides, outdoor training sessions, or product testing, we embrace an active lifestyle. Plus, with a generous health allowance, insurance, and discounts on our award-winning products, you will experience POC’s mission firsthand - protecting lives and enabling performance.
 



  





**What now?** 





 If you feel you are a great fit for this role, send your CV and cover letter to application@poc.com. We will review applications on an ongoing basis, although fully close the application window on 25th of May.

title: Implementation Specialist - Data Migration - Salesforce
description:
We are looking for a technical data professional who will perform data migration activities as a part of our consultancy service for customers. Core to this role is to be able to analyse business requirements and keep a good client focus. Daily tasks will be analysing data in different formats, preparing data maps, developing scripts to translate and migrate the data, developing data migration routines, and communicating the data migration process to clients. This role requires strong skills in both Microsoft SQL and Salesforce.
   

  

 The technical data professional will be working closely with the implementation team which is responsible for implementing new clients and servicing existing clients. The role will also include building close relationship with the software development team, which is responsible for the development of the product. This is accomplished by continually learning new technology and establishing and maintaining strong, long-lasting relationships with our customers. Thorough understanding of databases and business process mapping is expected.
   

  

**About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments**
* 3+ years’ experience in Microsoft SQL
* 2+ years’ experience in Sales Force as Administrator or Architect.
* Good communication skills in English (spoken & written).
* Strong focus on quality and service. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail required.
* Excellent teamwork skills with ability to work on a team with other business professionals in a friendly, focused environment along with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority.
* IT related degree or related experience.
* Experience with software implementation or software consulting or working closely with implementation teams.


**It would be great if you also have . . .**
* Salesforce Data Architect certification a plus.
* Experience of Intellectual Property and/or legal industries.
* Experience of working with a Legal /Partner environment.
* Experience of working in Microsoft Azure
* Experience in development tools, such as ASP.Net C# development in Visual Studio, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
* Knowledge of other Microsoft Office applications such as Access, Visio, Teams, SharePoint365.


**What will you be doing in this role?**
* Assist the implementation team with provide estimates for data migration and data updates
* Support the implementation team with data migrations and data updates.
* Understand development and production environments as well as technical architectures. This includes databases, web services and integration software.
* Anticipate problems and provide solutions.
* Take ownership of software defect tracking through documenting ‘bugs’, researching issues, validating fixes and communicating results.
* Transfer knowledge of business processes, suggest improvements and requirements to other co-workers
* Provide timely and accurate reports that adhere to standards on project status to stakeholders.
* Follow a thorough quality assurance process through the various phases of testing – including system testing. Develop system test plans, user acceptance test criteria with the customer.


**About The Team**
 This role will work as part of our IPMS Implementation team which consists of Consultants and Project Managers based across the EMEA region.
   

  

**Hours of Work**
 Full-time, permanent role based out of our Stockholm office on a hybrid basis, 2-3 days per week in the office.

title: Manager-Integration & Support Applications
description:

**This is what makes the position as Manager-Integration & Support Applications unique**
* Lead and mentor a team of integration developers, ensuring best practices and high-quality deliverables.
* Drive impactful change by collaborating with the Application Leadership Team to shape strategic technology decisions.
* Play a key role in implementing next-generation HR, Finance, and Technology systems that enhance business efficiency.
* Engage with cross-functional teams to lead innovation and streamline critical enterprise applications.


 The hiring manager for the role is
 **Sara Wennerström, Director of Application Management.** 
 She believes that work should be characterized by initiative, engagement, and a strong understanding of business processes and system support. As a manager, she is open, attentive, and committed to setting goals together with the team to achieve collective success.
   

  

***Read more about Dustin here***
**Your role & influence as
 **Manager-Integration & Support Applications****
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for leading and managing a team of application specialists, solution architects, integration developers and subject area experts to ensure that HR, Finance, Technology, and Product applications are scalable, secure, and aligned with business needs while fostering collaboration across departments and driving innovation to support Dustin’s strategic goals.
   

  

*Collaboration:* 
 Together with your team, you take care of the implementation of new systems, ensuring seamless integration and functionality while working closely with the respective departments to align technology with business needs.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Lead and mentor a team of 11 talented individuals in the roles of application specialists, solution architects, integration developers and subject area specialists.
* Create and optimize efficient processes within the team.
* Drive key initiatives to enhance application integration and support across HR, Finance, Product and Technology.


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

 You can find more on our benefits below in the vacancy.
   

  

****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual with around 5 years of experience leading developers and a solid technical background, skilled in leadership, collaboration, communication, decision-making, stakeholder management, and can can clearly explain the rationale behind decisions to the team.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Bring**
* Bachelor's degree within IT, with solid experience leading integration development projects and working with finance systems.
* A proven leader who enjoys cooperation, guiding others, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
* Ability to identify opportunities for leveraging new technologies to enhance business processes.
* A structured, adaptable mindset with a focus on maximizing business benefits and making confident decisions.

title: Infrastructure Architect, Management Access- Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 We are seeking a skilled and experienced Infrastructure Architect specializing in Access Management to join our Dynamic Unified Management Access team. The successful candidate will be hands-on responsible for designing, implementing, and managing Management Access solutions to secure and protect sensitive information and access. You will work closely with various stakeholders to ensure that our infrastructure is usable, robust, secure, and compliant with various industry standards.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Tech Services as an Infrastructure architect, you will:**
* Evaluate existing network infrastructure and recommend improvements or enhancements.
* Design, implement and maintain Management Solution to meet the security needs of the organization.
* Collaborate with the company customer teams, solution, security and compliance teams to establish and maintain network policies and procedures.
* Enable the deployment and integration of tools and technologies.
* Monitor the effectiveness of Management Access controls and make necessary adjustments to improve security posture and other capabilities.
* Provide expert guidance and support for the resolution of complex network security issues.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and developments in network technology development and broader cybersecurity practices.


**We believe you have:**
* A solid understanding of network topologies, and strong skills in designing, planning, and operational configuration to manage complex network structures efficiently.
* 5+ years of experience in IT architecture including designing and deploying Management solutions in an enterprise environment.
* Strong experience in network word and expertise in networking products especially experience with Juniper products is a plus
* Experience with platform management with HCI products like VMware, SimpliVity and Hypervisors like VMware and Hyper-V, Nutanix AHV
* Experience in license management and Active Directory (AD) environments
* This role requires Swedish citizenship and security clearance will be done on final candidate.


- 

**We also believe you have:**
* A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related.
* Certifications in networking and above-mentioned technologies is a plus
* Understanding of cybersecurity principles, standards, and best practices.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively across teams.


**We offer**
 We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing, fast-developing, and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Jarkko Kentala jarkko.kentala@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Stockholm/Örebro/Malmö (Hybrid)
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Manager - Enterprise Solutions | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Nordic offices (Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen), we are looking for Managers for our Enterprise Solutions chapter! About The Job At BCG Platinion, we provide sound advice on all relevant IT issues. In particular, the migration to the SAP S/4HANA solution against the background of the planned mainstream maintenance presents our customers with special challenges. The typical questions our customers have range from justification and business benefits of the SAP S/4 HANA Transition to optimized roadmaps taking into account the implications on overall architecture and also alternative solutions and platforms. To serve our customers even better, we would like to strengthen our Enterprise Solutions team. You work together with colleagues from Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international customer projects. Together with our customers, you actively develop superior, business value driven ERP and application architecture strategies, concepts and roadmaps and apply your sound technical and process-related understanding. Last but not least, you enjoy your work and embody the 'BCG Platinion Spirit' with your hands-on manner.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**This Is How You Can Make a Difference**
* An above-average degree in computer science, business informatics, business administration or a related field
* At least 6 years of relevant experience in the context of strategic ERP/CRM/SCM projects
* Strong methodological background, knowledge of relevant procedures in the context of ERP/CRM/SCM implementation approaches and methodologies
* Knowledge of the corresponding supporting procedures and tools (template management, solution management, release management, process modeling ...), incl. Business case and benefit management
* Overview of SAP S/4HANA, Microsoft D365, Salesforce or other solutions that are relevant in the context of large transformation projects (e.g., in the context of manufacturing, PLM, MES, etc.).
* Overview on modern, data-driven overall architectures, in particular the overall integration of different individual modules to end-to-end processes (Purchase-2-Pay, Order-2-Cash, Lead-2-Quote, Record-2-Report, Hire-2-Retire etc.)
* Exceptional analytical and conceptual skills
* Fluent in one Nordic Language and English (written and spoken)
* Strong client and result orientation
* Team spirit, communication and presentation skills as well as intellectual agility
* Ability to align individuals and organizations to a common goal


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape The World Of Tomorrow**
* Operational management of large-scale ERP/CRM/SCM projects, leading the BCG Platinion team
* Interacting with the client's leadership team (board, board, senior management) together with the BCG Platinion leadership team
* Development of ERP/CRM/SCM implementation and rollout strategies and plans in complex application landscapes and client environments
* Preparation and presentation of offers for major Enterprise Solutions projects
* Taking over internal tasks as part of the Nordic BCG Platinion Enterprise Solutions leadership (e.g., leadership of colleagues, driving content topics, ...)
* Participation in leadership meetings and practice group meetings of BCG Platinion in the Nordics


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

**Become a Part Of Our Team**
 Apply over our online portal now, with your CV, a relevant project list, and all pertinent references.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to national origin, color, age, sex, gender identity / expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or any other protected characteristic.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Senior Subject Matter Expert (SME) - Tax Accounting and Pillar Two
description:
**Company Description**
 Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

 Tax Operate is a newly established offering within our Tax & Legal practice, dedicated to providing clients with comprehensive tax process solutions, including expertise in navigating the new Pillar Two tax legislation and ensuring globally coordinated tax compliance.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about supporting some of Sweden’s largest companies with advice within Pillar Two and Globally Coordinated Compliance? We are seeking a motivated and experienced Manager/Senior Manager to join our Tax Operate Team in either Stockholm, Gothenburg, or Malmö. We value extensive experience in the tax accounting and reporting area, whether gained from another professional firm or an in-house position, as well as an interest in technology and innovation.
   

  

 Given the role has a strong focus on Pillar Two, it offers great versatility, with a broad interface across tax advisory, accounting, and data capture within our clients’ ERP.
   

  

 As part of our Tax Operate team, you will collaborate across Business Tax, Tax Technology Consulting, and Transfer Pricing to ensure transparency and the best use of our skills.
   

  

 We operate in a dynamic and international environment with an informal tone, offering an exciting career path with professional challenges and personal development, where quality, interdisciplinarity, and collaboration is paramount.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Policy and Technical Advisory:
+ Assisting clients in interpreting and communicating the OECD's Pillar Two Guidance and the Swedish Minimum Taxation Act, including coordination with our Global Technical Pillar Two Committee for complex issues and providing input on the Swedish implementation of the rules.

* Impact and Data Assessment:
+ Assisting clients in understanding the scope of the rules, including legal structure and data requirements based on our global data access model.

* Finance System Enhancement:
+ Facilitating customers to improve their current accounting data to support better data output to Pillar Two.

* Tax Process and Technology:
+ Supporting clients with establishing a solid Pillar Two process, including demonstrating Deloitte's own Pillar Two calculation solutions and 3rd party Pillar Two solutions in collaboration with Deloitte Tax Technology Consulting and Deloitte Consulting.

* Trusted Advisory:
+ Act as a trusted advisor on complex accounting matters, ensuring globally coordinated compliance and alignment with Pillar Two requirements.

* Eminence:
+ Build and disseminate knowledge within the Tax & Legal practice in tax accounting, with a specific focus on Pillar Two implications and globally coordinated compliance.
+ Contribute to the establishment and development of the Tax Operate organisation, with a strong emphasis on globally coordinated compliance and Pillar Two expertise.

* Leadership:
+ Lead and manage engagement teams to deliver exceptional client service, addressing globally coordinated compliance and Pillar Two considerations.


 Qualifications
   

  

**Skills and Experience:**
* Extensive experience in tax accounting, both IFRS and Swedish GAAP.
* Understanding of the Pillar Two framework and its practical implications on large MNEs.
* Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to navigate complex global tax compliance requirements.
* Excellent project management, communication, and stakeholder management abilities.


**Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree within relevant field, e.g. law and/or economics


 Additional Information
   

  

 Submit your application online as soon as possible, as we will review applications and interview candidates continuously. Your application should contain your:
   

  

* CV
* Cover letter including a motivation why you are interested in Deloitte and this position. You can upload the cover letter as a document.
* University grades


*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/.*
 If you have any questions regarding the position contact Jonas Ramber, Partner at Business Tax, jramber@deloitte.se or if you have questions about the recruiting process, please contact Anna Cygnaeus på acygnaeus@deloitte.se.
   

  

**What impact will you make?**
 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Strategic Enterprise Account Executive
description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.
   

  

 When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 5,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.
   

  

**Strategic Enterprise Account Executive**
**Why We Have This Role**
 Qualtrics is on the lookout for a proactive, collaborative seller that can help us lead and own the strategy for selling Experience Management (XM) SaaS within the largest accounts in the Nordics. We’re helping the world’s leading companies improve experiences. Our solutions allow our clients to have a 360° view of the entire experience enabling them to uncover what matters most to clients and employees with the ability to take action in real time.
   

  

 In the role, you will work with Major Accounts across a number of specific industries with an overarching objective to drive company revenue growth through net new customer acquisition and expansion in our current customer base. This person will work collaboratively to meet sales goals and deliver the highest standard of integrity, quality, and customer service to our clients.
   

  

**How You'll Find Success**
* Relationship Building: Master stakeholder mapping to cultivate relationships with multiple contacts within an account, ensuring lasting partnerships.
* Negotiation Skills: Navigate negotiations with professionalism, understanding the art of give-and-take.
* Multi-Selling Approach: Drive engagement with various business stakeholders in parallel to create multifaceted selling opportunities.
* Empathetic Competitiveness: While being competitive, possess the ability to empathise and understand others’ perspectives.
* Entrepreneurial Mindset: Take initiative to grasp the expected outcomes and context, working independently to drive results.
* Effective Communication: Influence effectively at all levels, creating trust and collaboration within the team.


**How You’ll Grow**
* By joining Qualtrics, you become part of a revolutionary team committed to shaping groundbreaking experiences.
* You will help us expand the XM category beyond where it is today with more advanced use cases & pioneering advancements in AI.
* Our mission is to build technology that positively impacts businesses and makes them more human.
* As a member of our global sales organisation, you will take ownership of a dedicated territory and develop robust strategies designed to drive demand and revenue.
* We foster an environment that encourages big-picture thinking, innovation, and creativity, enabling you to build relationships with multiple decision-makers and articulate the unique value proposition of Qualtrics.


**Things You’ll Do**
* Focus on acquiring new business and sell the Qualtrics Platform to a select number of key strategic accounts.
* Develop comprehensive multi-year account plans, from power maps to demand generation and closing strategies.
* Manage relationships between Qualtrics and senior executives of both client and prospect companies.
* Strategising internally with SDRs (sales development representatives), solutions consultants, partners etc to create demand and drive senior engagement in accounts.
* Gain a thorough understanding of prospects' business issues and industry challenges to craft tailored solutions.
* Build compelling business cases that demonstrate clear ROI and value for clients.
* Maintaining a real-time understanding of Qualtrics' offerings and the competitive landscape to provide win-based proposals and pricing strategies.


**What We’re Looking For On Your CV**
* Significant experience selling SaaS solutions, and experience in discussing strategic business issues at Director and C level in Large Strategic accounts.
* Significant experience working with Major/Strategic Accounts at a regional or global level.
* Significant demonstrated success in driving and navigating C-level engagement & connections at the highest level.
* Significant experience in leading, planning and closing 7 figure deals.
* Significant experience in owning the full commercial capacity of Strategic Accounts.
* Strong track record in achieving and exceeding sales quotas.
* Ability to be creative in driving engagement with new contacts within an account.
* Fluency in English and fluency in a Nordics language.
* You are passionate about educating potential clients on solutions relevant to their situation and helping them understand how the software can drive a return on investment for them.
* You can leverage your network in the market to generate interest in Qualtrics solutions.
* You have a desire to manage a territory like running your own consultancy.
* You engage with clients at all points of the sales cycle - from prospecting and acquiring clients, through demoing the Qualtrics product, to negotiating and closing, and beyond.
* You have the agility to adapt, pivot and change your approach based on the needs of your business.
* You partner well with internal teams and bring together internal resources that enable successful closure of deals.


**What You Should Know About This Team**
* Qualtrics global sales team is dedicated to changing the way our customers focus on experiences. Forrester reports that companies generate a 674% return on investment when using Qualtrics. Now that's a solution you can get behind.
* As an Enterprise Sales professional, you will focus on new revenue through strategic, relationship-based selling. Our most successful sales employees have a track record of exceeding quotas, acting as trusted advisors to clients and being passionate teammates.
* The Qualtrics platform is versatile, adding value to a limitless array of decision makers. If you love a strategic, analytics sales process working with a variety of industries, departments and buyers, selling Qualtrics XM will always keep you learning and growing.
* Challenges excite us, as we view them as opportunities for growth and positive transformation.
* We are not merely observers of change; we actively initiate and drive it.


**Our Team’s Favourite Perks And Benefits**
* Qualtrics Experience Program - A bonus each year for an experience of your choosing
* Worldwide and diverse community that enjoys helping each other
* At Qualtrics we are constantly working to create an environment where everyone feels safe and comfortable coming to work and can, as a result of our culture, make their best possible contribution to our team


**The Qualtrics Hybrid Work Model:** 
 Our hybrid work model is elegantly simple: we all gather in the office three days a week; Mondays and Thursdays, plus one day selected by your organizational leader. These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.
   

  

*Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.*
*Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws:* 
*Family & Medical Leave Act* 
*,* 
*Equal Opportunity Employment* 
*,* 
*Employee Polygraph Protection Act*
*Qualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.*
*Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind-the-scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.*

title: Chief Product Officer
job_function: Product Management, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: IT System Custom Software Development, Technology, Information and Media, and Software Development
description:
Join Our Team at Pythagoras!
   

  

 Pythagoras is on the lookout for an exceptional Chief Product Officer to drive our product vision and take our innovative B2B software solutions to the next level. If you have a strategic mindset, hands-on approach, and thrive in a dynamic environment, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Proven experience in leading a product management function
* Track record of successfully launching and scaling software products.
* Responsible for defining the company's overall product vision and strategy, aligning it with Pythagoras business objectives
* Report to CEO and collaborate closely with peers in the management team
* Oversees product development across the business, lead and align with the R&D management to ensure products meet customer needs while exploring new technologies and trends
* Full responsibility for the Product Road-map
* Lead, grow and develop the Next product organization to the next level
* Report to the CEO, actively participate in the management team meetings, be responsible for the product plan and participate in the strategic direction for the business
* Be actively involved with clients to understand the demands and collect product feedback from all client facing colleagues
* Communication with research companies as Gartner etc
* Keep track of competitors and alternative client opportunities, work to align the messaging used by the salesforce
* Continuously work with ways to understand the production demands in each market
* Work on and keep the product vision alive and define your market and prioritize the product demands
* Responsible for the pricing strategy
* Product lead in dialogue with strategic customers, partners and in M&A processes


**Essential Skills And Experience**
* Strategic product leader with a strong grasp of B2B business dynamics
* Business and Technical management experience from fast-growing, global software/SaaS company
* Excellent understanding of the Product-function in a software B2B context
* Experience from the Proptech industry is a plus
* Experience from M&A processes is a plus
* Master’s degree in Business or computer science, ITC or similar
* Fully fluent in English and Swedish verbal and written.
* Proven experience as successful and appreciated leader
* Inspiring, enthusiastic and solution oriented
* Pragmatic, down to earth and proactive
* Integrity and strong ethics


 What We Offer
   

  

* Be a key-employee and part of the next step of Pythagoras growth journey, becoming an increasingly international software company
* An exciting task to take on – managing and developing the product team, with pot. post-merger integration and scaling high up on the agenda
* Be part of transforming the Property tech market and help lower the Global CO2 emission (30% of the global CO2 emissions can be related to the Property sector).
* Work with a very competent and ambitious management team
* Great office in central Stockholm
* Competitive remuneration and benefits
* Opportunity to invest at attractive levels
* Join a company backed by the Nordic’s leading B2B software growth investor – interact, learn and develop with software peers in the Monterro sphere


 We are specialists in IT solutions and services within Property, Real Estate and Facilities Management. They consist of cloud-based SaaS services based on the latest technology and an IWMS platform with a graphical 3D model (GeoModel) that can be fed with many different types of spatial information.
   

  

**Our Passion:** 
 "We are the heart in tomorrow’s smart properties"
   

  

**Our Mission:** 
 "Enable clients to keep ALL property related information in one system by digitizing and modernizing the Real estate & FM industry. Thus, enabling better decision making through relevant and accurate information"
   

  

 At Pythagoras, we believe in fostering a work environment where diversity is valued and everyone is supported to reach their full potential. Join us and help transform the way businesses operate with leading-edge solutions.
   

  

**Apply Now** 
 to be a part of our journey and drive impactful change in the industry. We look forward to welcoming a hands-on strategic thinker and innovator!
   

  

**About Monterro**
 Monterro is a hands-on growth investor. We turn Nordic B2B software companies into market leaders by contributing our time, experience, know-how, and networks. And yes, we provide capital too. In fact, we invest our own capital, so we are personally committed to our mutual success. Monterro is headquartered in Stockholm with offices in Oslo, Copenhagen, Munich, and a software development centre in Hanoi. Learn more at monterro.com.

title: Manager / Senior Manager, focus Procurement to Management Consulting
description:
*Are you a procurement professional at Manager or Senior Manager level with at 5-10 years’ experience looking for taking the next step in your career? KPMG is a global leader in the procurement space, and we are now looking for leaders´ to our growing management consulting business in Gothenburg and Stockholm.*
**About Us And The Role**
 KPMG Management Consulting is growing and are now looking for experienced leaders with a strategic and analytical mindset committed to helping organizations improve in their business and value generation.
   

  

 Many of our clients are currently undergoing major strategic changes, e.g. establishing new business models, taking the next step in their digitalization journey, reviewing the resilience of their business or transforming to become truly customer-oriented, and our role is to guide the client in operationalizing their strategic choices.
   

  

 We support our clients in establishing professional and sustainable Procurement that exceeds the expectations from shareholders, management team, other departments and external bodies. This can involve;
   

  

* Operationalize procurement visions, ambitions and strategies
* Identify and mitigate supply / supplier risks
* Cost reduction and Category strategy development
* Develop new operating models and organization set-ups
* Develop and standardize Source-to-Pay processes
* End-to-end digitalization of procurement from strategy to implementation and value realization
* Improve supplier management including managing supplier risk and sustainability
* Improve purchasing reporting and forecasting


 We are working closely together with a broad range of domestic and international experts and we are using leading frameworks leveraging new technologies as well as our leading position in procurement, sustainability, risk and finance.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**We are looking for** 
 leaders with extensive Project management experience and the ability to lead, plan and deliver procurement development projects. You might have worked at a management consulting firm before, addressed strategic client challenges, or you have hands-on managed similar challenges in another type of organization or position.
   

  

 The positions are either based in Gothenburg or Stockholm.
   

  

**To be successful in this role** 
 , we think that you have at least 5 – 10 years’ experience within one or more of the areas below;
   

  

* Experience from leading development / transformation projects within procurement
* Experience from working in leading Source-to-Pay solutions
* Implementation of digital solutions supporting Source-to-Pay
* Supplier risk management including sustainable procurement
* IT sourcing


 Our client portfolio includes leaders in several different industries, including both national and multinational companies. It is considered a qualification if you have experience from automotive, industrial manufacturing, consumer goods or retail companies.
   

  

**Want to make a difference with us?**
 Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis. If you have any questions about the position, please don’t hesitate to contact Head of Procurement Advisory, Pontus Sandslätt, pontus.sandslatt@kpmg.se, or if you have any questions related to the recruitment process please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se
   

  

**We look forward to your application and for new colleagues to join our team!**

title: (Senior) IT Consultant - Principal Investors and Private Equity | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 More so than ever, technology is driving business growth and must therefore be a top consideration in M&A decision making. Assessing technological capabilities in the due diligence phase requires knowledge across IT architecture, enterprise systems and cybersecurity – we are looking for passionate talent! As a (Senior) IT Consultant for our PIPE (Principal Investors & Private Equity) practice area, you will be focused on helping the world’s largest private equity firms address their strategic technology challenges, whether they are buying or selling a business. We look for new colleagues in our offices in Stockholm, Helsinki, Oslo, and Copenhagen!
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
 ▪ bring multiple years of experience in IT strategy and consulting, professional software development or IT project management in a tech related corporate development or start-up
   

  

 ▪ gathered basic understanding of technology financials and how it impacts deal value
   

  

 ▪ are familiar with working within a Merger and Acquisition (M&A) environment, with a focus upon technology due diligence, technology carve-out, technology PMI or PE-related value creation initiative with a portfolio company
   

  

 ▪ are a strategic thinker who likes to work creatively and analytically in an environment focused on exceptional problem-solving
   

  

 ▪ bring stellar analytical and conceptual skills, strong customer focus and mental agility with a result-orientation
   

  

 ▪ obtained a university degree with above average academic performance in a STEM related field or business management
   

  

 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
 ▪ You will drive groundbreaking projects by using agile methods and modern approaches within the scope of strategic IT implementation for clients and by actively steering the relevant modules
   

  

 ▪ You will smooth the path for tailored, future-oriented customer journeys based on precise analysis of the situation and with current market developments and trends, such as machine learning, in mind
   

  

 ▪ You will design and optimize unique IT architectures within the framework of enterprise solution requirements, modern custom software developments, and sustainable digital solutions, including cyber resilience
   

  

 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of top talents, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we cultivate a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Förvaltningsledare till FO Ambulans
description:
Vi söker en driven ledare med god kännedom inom hälso- och sjukvårdsverksamhet som förvaltningsobjektet stödjer. Är du driven, har god kännedom om förvaltningsledning, verksamhetsutveckling och IT? Vill du vara med och forma framtidens förvaltningsarbete i en dynamisk organisation? Då kan du vara den förvaltningsledare vi söker!
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen som förvaltningsledare kommer du att leda arbetet med att verkställa beslutad förvaltningsplan på uppdrag av objektägaren och objektstyrgruppen. Du kommer att samordna och verkställa arbetet med informationssäkerhet i förvaltningsobjektet och arbeta i nära samarbete med Förvaltningsledare IT för att säkra både verksamhets- och IT-perspektiv. Du ansvarar för att genomföra det regionsgemensamma förvaltningsuppdraget, verkställa förvaltningsplanens mål inom givna ramar på ett kostnadseffektivt sätt. Vidare säkerställer du att förvaltningsprodukterna är användbara för objektverksamheten, godkänner leveranser från IT-leverantör och säkerställer kravställning på berörda projekt samt rapporterar och hanterar informationssäkerhetsrisker. Du dokumenterar förvaltningsstyrning löpande och statusrapporterar till objektägare och objektstyrgrupp.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Eftergymnasial utbildning eller erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig. Du har minst två års erfarenhet inom området, inklusive arbete med förvaltningsmodellen PM3 och ramverket ITIL. Vidare har du erfarenhet av projektledning, förändringsarbete eller uppdragsledning. Du har god förståelse för förvaltningsstyrning och livscykelhantering av IT-system. Förmåga att kravställa, utvärdera leverantörer och har kunskap om upphandlingar enligt LOU. Erfarenhet av budgetarbete och ekonomiuppföljning på övergripande nivå, samt kunskap om offentlig sektor och dess specifika krav. Meriterande med erfarenhet av it-stöd inom prehospital verksamhet.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Vi söker dig som är lösningsorienterad, strukturerad och ansvarstagande. Du har god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift, är självgående med ett proaktivt förhållningssätt, har god samarbetsförmåga och ett coachande ledarskap.
 



  





**Vi Erbjuder** 




 Ett utmanande och varierat uppdrag i en komplex och spännande miljö.
 



 Möjlighet att påverka och utveckla viktiga förvaltningsprocesser samt ett professionellt team.
 



 En central roll i en verksamhet som gör skillnad för människors liv och hälsa.
 



  





**Ansökan:** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering på AISABs huvudkontor.
 



 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**Har du frågor?** 




 Välkommen att kontakta kontakta Jani Sundqvist på jani.sundqvist@regionstockholm.se
 



  





 Facklig representant: lina-britta.rylander@regionstockholm.se
 



  





**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 16 maj
 



**Arbetsplats:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid

title: Director, Analyst - IT Services Sourcing (REMOTE: EUROPE)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
**What makes Gartner Research & Advisory a GREAT fit for you?**
* You enjoy helping clients with best practices and recommendations
* You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
* You are always learning and looking to discover what’s next in technology.
* You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.


 If this describes you, Gartner is looking for you! Gartner is an upbeat culture based on collaboration, teamwork, integrity and objectivity that values creativity and innovation. As a Gartner analyst, you’ll not only help clients solve complex challenges and deliver on key initiatives, you’ll grow your career and the scope of your impact across industries. We work hard — and we reward success with exceptional opportunity.
   

  

**About this role:**
 This role creates thought leading
 **IT Solution & Services Sourcing** 
 research for our IT Leaders clients and has conversations with client (Inquiry), stage presentations, teleconferences, and client meetings. It is important that you have a vision for how
 **IT Sourcing for Solution & Services** 
 will evolve worldwide
 **(outsourced, nearshore & offshore)** 
 and at a regional level.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As a Gartner analyst you will speak to Gartner clients either in a video-call, from the stage at a Gartner event or face-to-face during a sales support visit. In every client interaction analyst help clients solve difficult sourcing issues, review their documents and service provider proposals, and guide them on best practices that would lead to better outcomes. To support these conversations you will research markets, practices and trends and produce written research for Gartner clients to download and apply. Your topic coverage will include
   

  

* Reviewing Outsourcing services or Solution implementation RFPs clients have developed and need best practice guidance
* Share Gartner research and help them identify the best service providers in the market globally for the scope of services they are seeking support
* Review Services contracts from service providers for Outsourced services (applications or infrastructure) and identify gaps in the terms or SLAs or how the proposed terms may not be in their favor
* Conduct research and analysis in specific areas of expertise targeting client’s key initiatives & deliver high quality actionable advice through a variety of media.
* Write high quality, clear, actionable, advisory research documents.
* Remain ahead of the curve on developments and issues within these specified areas as well as applicable adjacent areas.
* Respond to client questions, via written responses, presentations, webinars or on Inquiry calls.
* Maintain the Gartner’s industry leadership reputation by responding to press inquiries or offer interviews to share Gartner’s insight
* Proactively work with the wider sales organization and deliver outstanding sales support to retain and grow the business


**What you’ll need:**
 It helps to be obsessed with your topic! Gartner analysts are correctly viewed as THE experts. This means you need to know your markets, vendors, trends, management practices, etc. and be able to see the forest
 *and* 
 the trees. Most Gartner analysts have many years of experience and enjoy solving sourcing problems and enjoy helping others. Being able to summarize Gartner advise and confidently respond to client questions on a 30 min call is a key competency to be successful in this role. To be able to cover any of the topics, you will need:
   

  

* Subject matter expertise in all phases of sourcing for IT services from 3rd party providers (outsourcing) in application & Infrastructure services (cloud hosting, software implementations & consulting services), as well as ongoing support and maintenance of the application & cloud services portfolio. This includes ability to review RFPs, Scope of work, contract terms, SLAs for enterprise and SaaS software implementation proposals, outsourced (onshore/offshore/nearshore) service deals.
* Knowledge of EMEA service providers is a must and knowledge of global service provider landscape, and the competitive interplay between incumbents, emerging providers, disruptors, and outsourcers is desirable. Additional knowledge on other markets, such as NA, APC and ANZ is preferrable.
* Sourcing services experience in 3 or more below IT Services Markets is required:
* Outsourcing Applications & Infrastructure (Hosting) Services (including offshore, nearshore) from strategy, supplier selection, contracts, and management of deal
* Cloud Transformation Services i.e Preparing and moving applications to the Cloud
* Cloud Hosting services including hyperscalers such as AWS and Azure.
* Enterprise Solutions implementations services (e.g., ERPs like SAP S4Hana, Oracle cloud, MS Dynamics, Desktop /Helpdesk solutions like Outlook365, ServiceNow. HCM and CRM SaaS Solutions like Workday, Salesforce etc.)
* Applications Testing Services - including Automated Testing, Crowd Testing, Security testing, setting up testing CoE – SLAs, operational aspects etc.
* Managed Security Services
* GenAI and how it impacts the IT services market
* Articulate and succinct communication skills. Publishing and Speaking engagements is an advantage
* Minimum of 10-15 years of experience in a research or technology related role, end-user client (buyer) experience desired.
* Experience with Professional Services contract development and negotiation is a plus
* Bachelor's or equivalent experience, Master's degree preferred


 #REMOTE
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:97900
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
